title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: All I had to do was make a short video showing my programming skills/knowledge. No actually interview, just a short 1 hour lesson on how to conduct the class. Must have an A in the class.
Interview Questions: Why would you like this job?

title: Art Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was fantastic, the recruiter was knowledgeable and understanding. She explained the career path with transparency. I'm really happy with how the interview went and the professionalism of the process with the company.
Interview Questions: How outside your profession do you channel your creativity?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Typically, the first interview is the first face-to-face meeting with the student Their goal is to get to know you and assess your skills and experience in ANSYS workbench and their needs for this particular role.
Interview Questions: Ansys workbench Question regarding static and dynamic analysis

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial one on one interview and then an interview with a presentation.  This was in front of six people.  There was an additional third round interview after this.
Interview Questions: I was asked to present to a group.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Over all experience was good. The interview panel is very welcoming. Questions were based on the previous projects done at Illinois Institute of Technology while studying here.
Interview Questions: About the previous projects done.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Meet first with Human Resources.  Human Resources ask general questions about goals and fit.  Next Human Resources escorts to the hiring manager where they ask about experience and questions your background to see if it matches with the opening.
Interview Questions: What are your long term career plans?

title: Graduate Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: There is just one interview. You get asked questions about yourself. I was asked about how do I organize the day. Just one interview to know me, with three people who work as well in the department.
Interview Questions: What do you do on a normal day? They wanted to know if I'm a responsible and organized person

title: System Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is.
Interview Questions: basic system engineer ques5ions experience as well

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was something you can expect from a typical job interview. Nothing was different than other job interviews that I ever had. Personally I was just nervous to be in an interview setting.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: One o One interview process.  First step: Apply after that send email.  Second: scheduled a time for  interview on campus.  Ask questions about: Networking question.
Interview Questions: Networking

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: They sent me an email and schedule a date and time then I had one interview in the school with two people and asking the general questions about the specific work.
Interview Questions: Do you work best alone or on a team?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Super easy, I got recommended by a friend that worked there. I think that and my resume were enough to get the job. They really just want someone competent and that is kind and willing to go with the flow.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can contribute to making this office a better place to work?

title: Equipment Inspector/Warehouse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very simple and straightforward. I was given an time for the interview, I reached there 5 minutes earlier. The interviewers were generous and understaing, made me comfortable and asked a few quesions to conclude the process.
Interview Questions: Educational background, why did I choose this job, previous work experience, availablity for working hours

title: Marketing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Traditional marketing related questions that are required for building an efficient marketing campaigns as well as designing the whole process. Digital solutions were crucial and important as a selection criteria
Interview Questions: Build a marketing campaign

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the post from handshake. Got an email for interview. I arrived for it on time. It was very nice conversation about the depart meant and my schooling career. Finally got an offer for the position within a week.
Interview Questions: pretty easy, straight forward questions

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: One on one. Behavioral and situational questions. What would you do in such and such situation. Tell us about a time… very straightforward and the interviewer was very nice. Felt more like a conversation
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you worked in customer service and your experience in being asked a question you don’t know the answer to.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward, it was one on one. It was just a discussion on the deliverables and I was able to analyze the process with the professor. I saw the role advertised through my department and I submitted my resume and keep checking on the professor till a day I was able to see him and discuss the task casually. That was it.
Interview Questions: We had general discussions on the job descriptions that lasted for about 30 mins

title: Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: it took 30 minutes for the whole process. after a quick introduction, few questions was asked by the interviewer. that's pretty much what they did. and good good good. after one week you will get the feedback and the result will be announced.
Interview Questions: why you teaching

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview had 1 round only. They ask very basic questions, nothing much technical about. references from within IIT do work, at least to get an interview. any prior experience would be helpful. interview lasts long for 15-20 minutes.
Interview Questions: WHAT DEPARTMENT ARE YOU FROM AND HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN AT IIT?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't any interview. You just have to get an A for the class that you want to teach, then you can become a TA for that class in a later semester.
Interview Questions: There was not interviews, simply apply and they'll let you be the TA

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: To get a position for research course at the institute. The interview was face to face with the research advisor. For the interview, I brought my resume and my transcript. The interview took about 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe about my resume

title: Foreman Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Scattered and unprepared.  They waited too long to pick their final candidates.  Once the got going, it moved pretty quickly.  Once hired though.  I was given  a ride from the office across campus and dropped off at the facilities garage and told good luck.  Absolutely no training or an orientation.
Interview Questions: They were just checking off on what candidates can do or not

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
easy and simple.I intoduced myself and then later started describing about my previous work experience and education.
later i was asked regarding how well i would fit this job.
next comes what are the strenghts and weakness of mine and how i would manage my weakness.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Sat down asked about customer service and background.
Then waited for response.  Very nice, quick, and competitive. People were nice, hours are flexible and interviewers are students too. yep yep
Interview Questions: What is Customer Service to you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Managed intramural sports where the manager checked on my team skills. They also required me to carry heavy equipment and be able to manage in teams. The atmosphere was great.
Interview Questions: How have you handled pressured before?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got email from the manager. And then schedule a interview and go to manager's office. I arrived there a little bit early and waiting for the manager. Almost I was speaking all the time and she was writing notes.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. The hiring process takes about 2 weeks. The initial interview was aimed to look at your particular interest in the job and the fields they had open, and to match you to one of those fields. The second was more on how you approach several situations.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced a challenging situation and how you handled it.

title: Recreational Sports Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online I got shortlisted and they told me to pick a date to interview in person there were 100 people I need to select the date and time from the available slots. Interview was good. Behavioural questions, situational questions.
Interview Questions: Behavioural questions,  what sports do you know,  customer service interview questions

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Met with several managers separately and talked for 30 minutes. Mostly had conversations with the managers and coworkers. Very laid back interview. No clear schedule on who to meet with, seemed like whoever was available.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about experience and background. No technical questions, just asking to see if you will fit into the culture.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was informed about the research project opportunity by email. Submitted my updated resume and cover letter. Two Principal Investigators reviewed my application and called for an interview. Easy Procedure.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about the instrumental analytical techniques and microbiological analysis experience?

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy interview. One to one interview, behavioural questions. It lasted for only about 20 minutes. As it was an on campus job so no background check was required and i got offer in about a month.
Interview Questions: Usual strength weekness

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and got called 2 days later for interview. and had a general discussion about the role, and got called in for training. which lasts about a month with 1 hour a day.
Interview Questions: What is your take on the role of production assistant?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: describe yourself, past experiences that will be help your project, amount of time that you could dedicate for the research, design exam, have to meet the professors who enable the grant for the research, submit various research articles that are in line with the project.
Interview Questions: past experiences that will helps your project

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was call for an in person interview. It was a one on one interview. They asked me questions about my resume and work experience.  They were extremely friendly and let me know in about a week that I got the job.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in your new career?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two people in a conference room who were the current Managers that I would be working under. They explained the job very thoroughly as well as what would be expected of me.
Interview Questions: Have you worked on a team before? If so, what do you bring to the table?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talked with the PI via webnar for 3 times. The whole process took about 3 weeks.  In the webnar, I introduced my research experience and expectations of future study and research.
Interview Questions: Can you stand working at weekends?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: A month long process, with an info session, written application, group process and then interview. It was well timed,  and the overall experience was fun and the interview was relatively easy. Group activities were interactive and had a lot of conversation involved.
Interview Questions: Your past leadership experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have to submit your application online or through the program director. After that there is a series of interviews. They already know you are a good candidate because you attend their school. They are mostly logistic questions.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on balancing school and work?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: I had a half an hour long meeting with the professor, where she asked me about my background in economics and my understanding of the job requirements. Also she asked me about my schedule and how I could fit this job in my schedule.
Interview Questions: What's your plan after graduation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: we have to show them a working project similar to research project before starting the position. Then show about how you can progress with the project if offered a position with them. You will be working directly for the professor in this role
Interview Questions: How do you develop application for research pupose

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Got an Interview Call , Scheduled an Interview Slot , Face to Face Interview with Staff Member ,
Tour in Employees Work Place , Final Offer Mail From the Higher Authority.
Interview Questions:
Tell Me About Yourself ?
Past Projects ?? Educational Qualification ??
How did u get to know about this Job ??

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: transfer from other school and it takes easy. only negotiation between professor and school. student don't need to worry. only  transfer of courses took long process. the transcripts need to be sent from original school instead of you personally
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a half an hour long meeting with the professor, where she asked me about my background in economics and my understanding of the job requirements. Also she asked me about my schedule and how I could fit this job in my schedule.
Interview Questions: The different principles of economics.

title: Associate Chemist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I talked with the manager for about an hour or two. He then showed me around the facilities while asking questions and letting me ask questions as well. He explains how the research was related to the school, and then on introducing me to other staff members that I could potentially be working with. They all asked me questions, some behavioral, other technical, and some that had to do with my past experiences. Not too difficult of an interview.
Interview Questions: A lot of behavioral questions, why are you applying here, where do you see yourself in 5 years, but also some technical questions as well, especially regarding HPLC

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: First they will ask about your availability. They schedule interview with professor. It will one and one interview. If professor know you very well then it will more like hr. If you are new to professor, then you will get asked by all concepts in the course.
Interview Questions: They will asked in details about all concepts in the course.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Simple straight forward interview.
Questions asked on technical background covered in the resume.
Questions asked about client services experience.
Case study questions related to customer service and script and data supervision.
One-on-one interview and single round. Either the manager takes it or a level-2 staff member.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where the client changes the deadlines?

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the resume you will get a mail from the supervisor to pick a time slot for an interview. When you pick time slot they will give a tour of the consoles you will be working on. After that, they will ask basic questions. Then they will choose some for training. When the training is done if you are able to record the class online you will be selected
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Interlibrary Loans Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: There really was not much of a review process. I came in one day and the guy who worked behind the circulation desk seemed to have an affinity for me. From there we talked, discussed the university and then he seemed to be interested enough to hire me.
Interview Questions: Nothing

title: Community Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, you need to apply the position via the job4hawks.com and the Community desk assistants position is under on campus job category. when applying, you need to fill out personal information and a few questions, some of which might be asked during interview. Then you just wait a community desk manager to contact you and schedule time for interview.
Interview Questions: How do you contribute to our team.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 20-minute phone call interview with one of the staff members talking about previous experiences on my resume, in-person interview with 4 staff members at the IIT campus focusing on how I would complete the job tasks that the position entailed, 1:1 interview with department head.   This all occurred in less than 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position at IIT?  How do you understand the Strategic Plan, Many Voices, One Vision?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Resume submissions through cmc portal and then resume was picked up and call for interview and then interview with manager and then ssn was process all was very good experience
Interview Questions: No technical questions only behavioral questions and about library works

title: Student Diversity Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It is a face-to-face interview. I would rather describe it as a talk. It is an easy process anyway. The interviewer and I sat around a table, and shared our view of recent hot topics. And the interviewer would wrote down your key feature and asked some personal question like why I was interested in this non-paid work.
Interview Questions: What's my view of diversity.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through email after being referred by a past employee. The interview date and time were set according to my availability and convenience. One supervisor is going to question you and more often than not, if you are called for an interview, you are sure to get a job unless you screw up majorly.
Interview Questions: How organized are you?

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very long wait between multiple interviews with staff, and it seemed they weren't prepared for the interview. Too many cooks in the kitchen during the interview process, which seemed unnecessary once in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basically they go through your resume and ask you a few questions about it. The first question is always "tell me about you". The interview took about 20 minutes and the interviewer (which is my boss now) was very kind. You don't have to worry about being nervous, they'll make you feel comfortable. Before you start you are asked to do a background test.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your life.
Which major are you studying at the IIT?

title: Technical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: A screening interview is a type of job interview that is conducted to determine if the applicant has the qualifications needed to do the job for which the company is hiring. A screening interview is typically the first interview in the hiring process if the company. A screening interview is a type of job interview that is conducted to determine if the applicant has the qualifications needed to do the job for which the company is hiring. A screening interview is typically the first interview in the hiring process if the company. A screening interview is a type of job interview that is conducted to determine if the applicant has the qualifications needed to do the job for which the company is hiring. A screening interview is typically the first interview in the hiring process if the company
Interview Questions: Previous Experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Got an email for a face to face interview and the process was really quick (about 3 days). Got an email few days after interview with an offer. Very easy and quick process
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Supervisor took the interview, After I applied he replied me with date and time, I have attended and after couple days from then he mailed me that I was offered a job
Interview Questions: About my projects, My team work experience

title: IPRO Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: A casual interview with lead instructor. Asked questions about leadership experience, project management experience, general fit questions. Very relaxed and easy. Interested in my educational background. Seemed happy to have another potential instructor on board with similar background to the interviewer.
Interview Questions: What leadership experience do you have?

title: Research Associate/Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. My Employer happened to be a professor who took note of a few of my class projects and was impressed. He happened to have an open position for a student to fill in. He thought I would be a good fit and offered me the position. Sorry no questions!
Interview Questions: Sorry no questions!

title: CDA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applicant had to submit a Cover Letter and Resume. Upon sending it, the applicant was interviewed by an Employee at the RGL. The applicant was notified of the organization's decision after 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Are you a part of any groups/organizations on campus?

title: Community Desk Manager, Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was told to wait in a lobby for about 20 minutes, given materials to review about the jobs I had applied for, and then escorted into a very large room with several tables and seated at one in particular that had two staff members: one from the Office of Campus Life and one from Residence and Greek Life. They took turns asking questions and then wished you a good day when the process was over.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you felt you were in conflict with someone you were working with and how did you resolve the situation?

title: Community Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Apply when they advertise it. Takes about a month. They approve your resume and cover through a point system. Based on your score they will decide whether they give you an interview or not. Interview is pretty standard, they look for customer service experience, etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: talk with the professor, apply the position, the professor check my background, and ask some easy questions, tell me what mainly work need to do daily. Then go to department, and tell the office my application.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with this course?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There's no interview, you only need to get As on a certain classes. This position is for undergraduate students. It is different for graduate students. Some higher level class TAs only hire graduate students, and the pay is a lot better.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
- Received email confirmation and was invited to within 2 weeks of submitting application materials
- Initial phone interview with who would become my supervisor in the office
- 2nd interview with 4 members from the office
- 3rd 1:1 interview with director of the office
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: As far as the interview process goes, you meet directly with who you will be working with as you would with other businesses. The hiring process can take some time but this is similar in other places as well.
Interview Questions: How well you can react to a question that doesnt require your expertise.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very kind but had asked few deep technical question and some background questions
Interview Questions: What is mm theory in Finance?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Wheaton, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple meeting at Wheaton campus to discuss about the work and timings. They need experience/knowledge in HTML/CSS for website stuff.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is not important thing for this position. If you have great personality, meet requirement, and have open position, they will hire you because you are a student in that school
Interview Questions: Have you ever had the hard time when serving the customer? if so, explain how you overcome the hard time with that customer.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview process. Just write to Professors if you are interested in their research, and they might consider to let you work with them. A Professor might not give you the RAship right away and could ask you to work on a research project for a semester, so that s/he can evaluate whether or not s/he wants to work with you.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the research

title: Support Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume and asked a friend for a referral. Got selected for an interview on campus. Attended in business casual, formal wear not required. Very friendly interviewer. He was courteous and gave a lot of opportunity for me to throw positive light my relevant experiences. I was asked to fill out a technical questionnaire before the interview started so he could gauge my IT knowledge and proficiency. It was relatively simple and guided the interview questions.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with an unfamiliar situation?

title: AV Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, Simply question, behavioral . The interview was smooth. The interview was manger of all the student employee. He was very nice. He asked question about my classes.. He asked if I could work weekends.
Interview Questions: Do you know what shure is?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not really required. All you needed was minimal amount of lab experience, and as long as you can show proof of that, you are allowed to work
Interview Questions: No interview questions were given during the process of admission

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: First round of phone interview followed by personal interview with the research advisor. During phone screening the advisor explained about the project and the requirement for the role. Later I was scheduled for personal interview which lasted for 1hour during which I was given a tour around the research facilities of the Mechanical Department.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience on 3D printing?

title: Community Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: You have to fill out an online application form and submit a cover letter. After about three weeks you would be contacted to let you know whether or not you passed the first phase and to schedule an interview. The interview consist of a panel of three people. They ask questions based on different situations to learn how you would handle them. You would be contacted within a week if you are selected for the position.
Interview Questions: What was one situation where you had to resolve conflict?

title: Facilities Foreman Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Bait and switch, job description is not what I actually do on a daily basis
Interview Questions: I asked the most difficult questions, there is no level of competence in the facilities department at IIT

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring is a simple process. We need to look out for jobs through Career Management Center, through colleagues and many other ways. Next step would be create and submit Resume Online for verification. Applying for jobs with your resume. If selected you will be called by the respected department personnel and be interviewed about your experience related to the job you have applied for. Results for the interview vary from 2-3 weeks, depends. Its a great place to work with, experienced management and helpful.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. Questions are asked depending on your resume and also related to the position you have applied for.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Provided resume. spoke on experiences from resume which had work experiences. The employer gave a summary of the duties and responsibilities for the position applied. Employer was very polite and also was a very pleasant person.
Interview Questions: attention to detail

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: You must take an open book Math Test. The topics on the math test are Calculus, Multivariate Calculus, Differential Equations and Linear algebra. At the interview they ask you about how patient are you with tutoring students and do you just give them the answer. The interviewer is very nice and friendly. If you get a perfect score on the Math Test, they will more than likely hire you.
Interview Questions: Please how would a non-homogeneous differential equation to a student learning it for the first time.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It's about 20 mins panel interview. Very general questions, like how do you feel like working as a receptionist? How will you prioritize works in tight time frame? Tell me sth about your organizational skills. etc. I thought they just wanted to find someone they felt easy to work with.
Interview Questions: If someone asks you a question you don't know, how do you handle it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: First of all, the professor asked me where I come from. Then, asked me that what is my last design and went me to explain the detail.
Interview Questions: what is your last design

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Only one in-person interview required. The interview was more of a behavioral assessment interview wherein my manager examined my communication skills and team skills.
Interview Questions: Why are you pursuing your MBA after an undergrad in engineering?

title: CDA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewing to maintain my position for the upcoming academic year. Extremely basic and traditional interview questions were asked. Interviewer did not seem truly interested in the process and had his nose in his notebook for the majority of the interview. If you go in with your strengths, weaknesses, goals, and history that may help on the job, you will be just fine.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was invited for a face to face interview. They asked basic questions about pertinent work experience. An offer was made at the end.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite color?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Online submission of resume and quick cover letter.
After getting an email from the supervisor, I spoke with her and the director for an 1:1 interview.
As this is a small organization, they were very friendly and open to new ideas.
They seem to focus usually on students that have experience in software and website development along with databases.
Overall it was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: simple, required work study
Interview Questions: Give an example of your problem solving skills.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois Institute of Technology (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: Internal application followed by a notification of interest from the hiring party. I then had to notify my current manager before I could move forward with the interview process. After two face to face interviews I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Do you have any issue working for a woman?
